attributes.action: Ask the British people to consider voting on the country's continued membership of Europe
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the petitioners ask that the following questions be asked of the British people in a referendum.

We the petitioners believe that we should restore democracy with three simple questions, no rhetoric and a finality that will legitimise our participation in the European project or allow the Nation to remove itself from a Federal Europe we have not yet voted on.

The three questions we propose that the British public be asked are as follows:

1. Do you wish Britain to be a sub-state of a Federal Europe Y/N.

2. If the British public votes to leave Europe, would you like to negotiate to become a trading partner with Europe Y/N.

3. If the British public votes to stay in Europe, would you like to join the Euro Y/N.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
